qas.question: What name is given to the bronze line on the floor of a heliometer?
Which direction does la Meridiana run?
What image is projected on the floor of the heliometer?
What has lunar observatory built in 1690?
What is the name of the gold line on the floor of a helimeter?
What image is projected onto the dome of the heliometer?
What signs are a tribute to pagean customs?

context: <b4_0>The cathedral<b4_0/> has <b5_0>a heliometer<b5_0/> (<a0_0>solar "observatory"<a0_0/>) of 1690, one of a number built in Italy in the 17th and 18th centuries. The device itself is quite simple: a tiny hole in one of the minor domes acts as pinhole camera, projecting an image of <a3_0><b7_0>the sun<b7_0/><a3_0/> onto the floor at solar noon (12:00 in winter, 13:00 in summer). There is a bronze line, <a1_0><b6_0>la Meridiana<b6_0/><a1_0/> on the floor, running <a2_0>precisely N/S<a2_0/>. The ends of the line mark the positions as at the summer and winter solstices; <b8_0>signs of the zodiac<b8_0/> show the various other dates throughout the year.
